required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Histological Evaluation in the Efficacy of GentleWave in Root Canal Pulp Tissue Debridement and Disinfection of Difficult to Reach Areas in Mandibular Human Molars II. An In-vivo Study.
clinical_study.official_title: Histological Evaluation in the Efficacy of GentleWave in Root Canal Pulp Tissue Debridement and Disinfection of Difficult to Reach Areas in Mandibular Human Molars II. An In-vivo Study.

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand and learn better the efficacy of GentleWave and obtain histological evidence of the efficacy of this new technology done in-vivo

primary_outcome.measure: Visualization of the amount of pulp tissue left behind after GentleWave procedure
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of tooth extraction(immediately after GentleWave procedure)
primary_outcome.description: Visualization of the amount of pulp tissue left behind after GentleWave procedure as assessed by reviewing the histological serial sections under the light microscope

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with the presence of bacteria inside the root canal and inside the dentinal tubules as assessed by observation under the light microscope
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of tooth extraction(immediately after GentleWave procedure)

intervention.description: Subject teeth will receive a partial root canal treatment with the Sonendo GentleWave system followed by extraction of the tooth and histological evaluation of the tooth

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Only teeth that patient decided to have the extraction done instead of having any other type of dental treatment and teeth extracted at patient's petition.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Teeth with root fractures or previously root canal treated teeth.
- Teeth with severe loss of structure
- Children

overall_official.affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

facility.name: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
